DOC.detailed_description: Evidence-based nutritional intervention achieve sustain optimal growth young child cystic fibrosis ( CF ) exist , despite urgent need . Such intervention could positively change course clinical lung disease enhance survival child . The primary objective NIH fund clinical trial conduct multi-center , randomize , control trial compare two intervention : behavioral plus nutrition intervention nutrition ( attention control ) intervention . All subject receive nutritional care consistent 2001 CF Consensus Conference guideline pediatric nutrition . The specific aim : 1. determine impact behavioral intervention energy intake weight gain ; 2. examine durability behavioral intervention 's impact growth ( weight height ) one year follow treatment ; 3. explore relation physical activity growth . The central hypothesis behavioral intervention lead well growth measure change weight height age z score . Outcome data ( energy intake measure 7-day diet record , weight , height ) obtain baseline , post-treatment ( 6 month ) , 12-month follow-up ( 18 month post baseline ) . Secondary measure include body mass index , body composition measure dual energy x-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) skinfolds , growth velocity .
